intro: Stigmatodon limae, commonly known as the Lima orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and its ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its root system is adapted for epiphytic growth, allowing it to attach to tree trunks and other surfaces. The botanical features of Stigmatodon limae make it a popular choice for both horticultural and conservation studies.
